conclusion: Need to analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph to determine acceleration direction.
Graph shows velocity on y-axis and time on x-axis, starts at origin (0,0), velocity increases from 0 m/s to approximately 20 m/s from 0 to 10 seconds.
Slope of a velocity-time graph represents acceleration.
Graph shows a positive slope from 0 to 10 seconds, indicating increasing velocity over time.
Positive slope means positive acceleration during this interval.
In vertical motion, positive acceleration means accelerating downwards due to gravity.
During the 0 to 10 seconds interval, the direction of the acceleration is downward.
The direction of the acceleration during the 0 to 10 seconds interval is downward.
